DataElement.preferredName: Patient Uncontrolled Concurrent Disease or Disorder Exclusion Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response for questions as to whether a person has an uncontrolled, concurrent disease, any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person, that would restrict entrance or bar from participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Uncontrolled Concurrent Disease or Disorder Exclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to any uncontrolled abnormal condition that occurs during the course of a clinical study as a medical and/or social characteristic that prevents a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Uncontrolled Concurrent Disease or Disorder Exclusion Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Not controlled, regulated, or constrained.:Occurring or operating at the same time.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Exclusion; the act of restricting entrance or barring from participation.

Concepts.definition: Occurring or operating at the same time.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have uncontr
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have uncontrolled intercurrent illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, diabetes mellitus, mesymptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirement?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled diabetes mellitus (fasting plasma glucose greater than 160 mg/dL, greater than 8.9 mmol/l)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: eligibility
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have uncontrolled intercurrent illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection,symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirement?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled diabetes mellitus?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled diabetes mellitus (fasting plasma glucose greater than 130 mg/dL)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have uncontrolled intercurrent illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection,symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia (other than atrial fibrillation with controlled ventricular rate), or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirement?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled Type 1 or Type 2 diabetes or an elevated risk of hyperglycemia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled Type I or II diabetes mellitus, defined as fasting blood glucose of greater than 160 mg/dL [CTCAE Grade greater than or equal to 2] and HgA1c greater than 8%?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, uncontrolled hypertension, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, interstitial lung disease, serious chronic gastrointestinal conditions associated with diarrhea, evidence of any acute or chronic viral illness or disease, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection requiring antibiotics (except as noted in protocol), symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, unstable cardiac arrhythmia not controllable with medications, eletrocardiographic evidence of ischemia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness or infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have uncontrolled intercurrent illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirement?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have uncontrolled intercurrent illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirement?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, uncontrolled ventricular arrhythmia, recent (within 3 months) myocardial infarction, uncontrolled major seizure disorder, unstable spinal cord compression, superior vena cava syndrome, extensive interstitial bilateral lung disease on high resolution computed tomography (HRCT) scan, or psychiatric illness that would limit compliance with study requirement?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled, significant inter-current or recent illness including, but not limited to, conditions noted in section 3.2.17 of the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled intercurrent illness including but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, interstitial lung disease or active, non-infectious pneumonitis, symptomatic congested heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, uncontrolled arterial hypertension, stroke within 6 months prior to start of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have HbA1c greater than 8.5% at screening?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active uncontrolled infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled intercurrent illness (e.g., including but not limited to uncontrolled HTN [systolic BP greater than 150, diastolic BP greater than 100], symptomatic congestive heart failure [CHF], unstable angina pectoris, ischemic myocardial infarction (MI) within 6 months, cardiac arrhythmia, or  transient ischemic attack (TIA or cerebrovascular accident (CVA) within 6 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled, significant inter-current or recent illness including, but not limited to, conditions noted in section 3.2.16 of the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have severe intercurrent illness or comorbidity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an uncontrolled intercurrent illness or any other significant condition(s) that would make participation in this protocol unreasonably hazardous?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled intercurrent illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection; symptomatic decompensated congestive heart failure; unstable angina pectoris; cardiac arrhythmia; and known inadequately controlled hypertension?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled intercurrent Illness including, but not limited to, ongoing active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure (New York Heart Association Class III or IV), unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have uncontrolled intercurrent illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, clinically significant cardiac arrhythmia, uncontrolled major seizure disorder, unstable spinal cord compression, superior vena cava syndrome or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirement?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness, including but not limited to ongoing or active infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled intercurrent illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, interstitial lung disease or active, non-infectious pneumonitis, congestive heart failure New York Heart Association (NYHA) Grade greater than or equal to 3 (See Appendix C), unstable angina pectoris, and cardiac arrhythmia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled intercurrent illness including, but not limited to, symptomatic congestive heart failure (New York Heart Association Class III or IV), unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, recent myocardial infarction (within the last 6 months)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including, but not limited to, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, active bleeding diatheses or renal transplant?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled intercurrent illness and is currently receiving systemic antimicrobial treatment for active infection (viral, bacterial, or fungal) at the time of starting treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 29
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled intercurrent illness (including but not limited to interstitial lung disease or active, non-infectious pneumonitis) or a history of (non-infectious) pneumonitis that required steroids?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 30
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled intercurrent illness, including but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, uncontrolled hypertension, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, interstitial lung disease, serious chronic gastrointestinal conditions associated with diarrhea, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirement, substantially increase risk of incurring AEs or compromise the ability of the patient to give written informed consent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 31
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have serious, uncontrolled medical disorder, non-malignant systemic disease including but not limited to: active heart disease including symptomatic heart failure (NYHA class 3 or 4), unstable angina pectoris, uncontrolled cardiac arrhythmia or interstitial lung disease, uncontrolled major seizure disorder, unstable spinal cord compression, superior vena cava syndrome, extensive interstitial bilateral lung disease on High Resolution Computed Tomography (HRCT) scan?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 32
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled intercurrent illness (including but not limited to interstitial lung disease or active, non-infectious pneumonitis) or a history of (non-infectious) pneumonitis that required steroids?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 33
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled intercurrent illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 34
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled intercurrent illness that would limit compliance with study requirements?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 36
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled intercurrent illness or clinical evidence of an active infection at the time of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 37
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any uncontrolled intercurrent illness that would make participation in this study unduly burdensome or unsafe?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 38
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an uncontrolled intercurrent illness or any other significant condition(s) that would make participation in this protocol unreasonably hazardous?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 39
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an uncontrolled intercurrent illness including but not limited to active bleeding diatheses, poorly controlled infection/disorders or nonmalignant medical illnesses that are uncontrolled or whose control may be jeopardized by the treatment with the study therapy?
